summary: This is an email chain from October 18, 2019, forwarding a message from attorney Gloria Allred to federal prosecutors. Allred states she has a new client who is an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein from the 1990s and is willing to travel to New York for a victim meeting on October 23, 2019. The email discusses scheduling an interview.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney who sends an urgent email stating she has a new client who is an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein from the 1990s, willing to travel for a meeting.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'E' in the subject line and by name in the body; the individual whom the new client alleges is a perpetrator.

connections.description: Allred is representing a client who is an alleged victim of Epstein, placing her in an adversarial legal relationship with him.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Meeting in New York
events.description: A victim meeting is scheduled to take place in New York; Gloria Allred's new client is willing to fly there to attend.

events.title: Allred's Urgent Email to Prosecutors
events.description: Attorney Gloria Allred sends an urgent email to federal prosecutors informing them of a new alleged victim client from the 1990s and requests a call to discuss.

locations: Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Allred, Maroko & Goldberg office at 6300 Wilshire Blvd., Suite 1500)
keyFacts: Attorney Gloria Allred contacted federal prosecutors on October 18, 2019, about a new client alleging victimization by Jeffrey Epstein.
The alleged victim is from the 1990s, indicating the timeframe of the alleged abuse extends back decades.
The victim was willing to fly to New York for a scheduled victim meeting on October 23, 2019.
The communication shows ongoing investigative activity and victim outreach by prosecutors after Epstein's death in August 2019.
The email is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and contains standard legal privilege disclaimers.
